Description: Stamp (vessel): quarter-qisṭ. Measure of olive-oil. Six line Kufic inscription. Made of green glass. Chipped at top and bottom.
Curator's comments: See also OA+ 4286.There is a second remarkably similar die of this denomination with the legend arranged in the same way. Specimens are most easily distinguished by the ʿayn of ʿUbayd and qāf of qisṭ. Examples of the second type are: Casanova 1893, 111; Petrie 1926, 108; Viré 1956, 10; Launois 1957, 31; Miles 1963, 9; Balog 1973, 4. A large number of specimens have not been illustrated and may belong to either type or, conceivably, others. Bibliography: Casanova, P. 1893. Abdul Wahhab). ‘Cahiers de Tunisie’ IV, 17-90; Launois, Aimée. 1957.
